page.title: 17SECTION l0 - LAKE ULLSWATER
page.content: ECOLOGY - On the east side there are 3 paths with access from the road. These link up with other fellside paths. On the west side a path along the lake shore. EMPLOYMENT - Farming and Tourism FARMING - Land used for grazing sheep and a few cattle TOURISM - Public access to the lake shore on the west side with year round mooring facilities. Sailing, fishing, windsurfing, canoeing and swimming. LAND COVER - 0l = Sharrow Bay Hotel and Country Club, own boat house and landing stage. 05 = road to Howtown, cars towing caravans are forbidden. l2 = farmland for grazing. l4 = wood- land - deciduous trees. l9 = Lake Ullswater. AMENITIES - 0l = l9. 02 = l2. 03 =l4
